name: yugabyte-docker-manager
title: Yugabyte Docker Manager
description: Create, manage, and connect to YugabyteDB clusters running in Docker containers
author: pgyogesh

preferences.name: terminal
preferences.title: Terminal Application
preferences.description: Terminal to open for YSQL/YCQL connections. Auto-detect tries Ghostty first, then iTerm2, then Terminal.app.

commands.name: create-cluster
commands.title: Create Cluster
commands.description: Create a new YugabyteDB cluster with specified nodes and version

commands.name: manage-clusters
commands.title: Manage Clusters
commands.description: Manage all YugabyteDB clusters with options to start, stop, scale, or delete

commands.name: view-cluster-services
commands.title: View Cluster Services
commands.description: View services running in a YugabyteDB cluster and access their UIs

tools.name: get-clusters
tools.title: Get Clusters
tools.description: Get a list of all YugabyteDB clusters with their status, version, and node count

tools.name: get-cluster-details
tools.title: Get Cluster Details
tools.description: Get detailed configuration for a specific cluster including ports, GFlags, and connection strings

tools.name: get-cluster-services
tools.title: Get Cluster Services
tools.description: Get live service status for each node in a cluster including running processes

tools.name: run-yb-admin
tools.title: Run Yb-Admin Command
tools.description: Run a yb-admin command inside a YugabyteDB cluster to get live admin details like master/tserver lists, tablets, tables, load balancer status, universe config, and more

tools.name: run-ysqlsh
tools.title: Run Ysqlsh Query
tools.description: Run a SQL query or ysqlsh meta-command against a YugabyteDB cluster to inspect schema, query data, check catalog views, and run YugabyteDB functions

tools.name: run-yb-ts-cli
tools.title: Run Yb-Ts-Cli Command
tools.description: Run a yb-ts-cli command on a YugabyteDB tablet server node for diagnostics like listing tablets, checking server readiness, hybrid time, and intent counts

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
